description: Etobicoke is a relaxed area along the Humber River. It's saturated with green spaces and conservatories, making it a premier destination for outdoor sports, hiking, and nature walks. Its abundance of parkland and lakes makes it a typical spot for fishing, picnicking, and camping out, especially in warmer months. The peaceful area is also enjoyed by families, who appreciate its boardwalks and sports facilities. Locals enjoy the variety of golfing and country club opportunities, which also provide lessons for golfers of any skill level.

reviews.title: Anime North is not family friendly
text: I purchased a ticket for $48.25 to bring my 4 year old to experience the Anime North event yesterday. We had to take an uber over with a baby carseat since we currently haven't bought a new car yet since we got rid of the old one. We arrived to find hundreds people crowding outside all around the building. People were everywhere with seemingly no organization at all. It was quite a mess. We ended up walking around carrying a heavy carseat and the baby talking to at least 10 different staff members over the course of 45 minutes in an attempt to figure out where I could potentially stow the car seat so that I wouldn't have to carry it everywhere with me during the event. Unfortunately, no one seemed to care at all and was not able to help us find a place to put the car seat, and eventually, we were ultimately forced to leave and not attend the event. I was surprised that there was nowhere to check in personal items like this, or that there was no storage place somewhere to hold the car seat temporarily for a couple of hours. This is the only venue out of many that I've brought my boy to over the years that didn't have any way to help with stowing or checking in some personal items temporarily. I've been to events with over 40k people in attendance and all of them have ways to accommodate checking in of personal items. Needless to say, I am not happy with my experience yesterday at all. Reached out to the organizers but was not offered any refund. I would not recommend Anime North to people with young children as it is not family-friendly at all. Personally, I will never attend this event again in the future.

reviews.title: SIOC 2020
text: Quite a place, food  for such a large place, was excellent. The staff were attentive and the rooms were conducive to great presentations.

reviews.title: Business
text: Toronto Congress Centre the place to host any huge function. Friendly staff very clean aisles free wifi so you can always be reached
Fine dining restaurant with very good wine.

reviews.title: Great place to have a trade show
text: We visit the venue 2 times/year for trade shows. It’s a top notch facility- the food available on site is good and there are healthy choices available. They also have beer available during our particular function.
The washrooms are clean and they have gone with hand dryers over paper towels in an environmental initiative.
There is lots of free parking and the facility staff do a great job of managing waste.

reviews.title: Fantastic gourmet food for lunch during the trade shows!
text: I have been visiting Toronto Congress Centre for trade shows at least 20 years. This year I was really impressed of the quality and variety of the Concession restaurants buffet lunch. Food is fresh and tasty, has many healthy choices, eat there every day for 3 days.
Thank you for keeping up with the trends! The coffee stand in the North Building also had excellent latte.
Impressed also by the cleanness of the exhibit halls and washrooms, overall a pleasure to visit this professional facility.

reviews.title: Overpriced Coffee & Food
text: Attending a trade show. The food is overpriced. The coffee is overpriced. Medium sized coffee - $4.00 Canadian - compare to $2.00 at Tim Hortons or even $2.45 at Starbucks which is what they serve.
No place to sit. Limited just seating areas.

reviews.title: Buffini Event
text: Always good events, well run and good food on the premises. Attractive building, good washrooms. Clean, well set up, good acoustics and fresh water.

reviews.title: Not Impressed
text: As an exhibitor in a trade show, I found them to be unorganized and not helpful. The investment was more in “security” staff that struggled with English.
Biggest issue - shipping and receiving dock had NO one in charge. No management at all!!!

reviews.title: Toronto RV Show 2019
text: 2nd year now we have attended was as big as ever and free parking always a good hook. We purchased a glamper after last years show with dreams of Key West or Alaska in our futures all forthe love of 2 cocker spaniels we cant live without. Did find our next upgrade probably a few years down the road.

Building is large, many entrances, free parking, well laid out, good lighting, nice temperature.  Many accessible clean washrooms with walk thru's to other areas, dont get lost going out the wrong door.

reviews.title: Easy facility to navigate however limited onsite food
text: Plan ahead for food or drinks (on-site is okay but pricey) as there are a few good food options close by that fill up.
The facility is very clean and well organized with a good variety of room sizes.

reviews.title: Very good time spent at the Toronto Congress Centre
text: Attended the Esri Canada User Conference at the Toronto Congress Centre and cannot think of anything that wasn't very good.  Access to the Centre is good as it is near Highways 401, 409 and 427.  There is a lot of parking, which was free on this day.  Facilities inside are also first class - large main presentation areas, as well as smaller rooms.  The food and refreshments served at lunch and during breaks were also good.

reviews.title: Enjoyable
text: Visited the Toronto Congress Centre for the first time for the Baking & Sweet Show and the parking is very accessible and there was ample parking.  The convention space was nice, nothing to complain about!

reviews.title: seemed totally unprepared for Anime North convention
text: Lots of big open space inside for registration, dealers, etc. I'm not sure if it's up to TCC staff or convention staff to clean during the convention, but the washrooms were gross. Pretty much no vegan or even healthy food options around the TCC, I managed to find a veg wrap across the road at the International Plaza. Outside looked like a construction zone, not convention grounds. There were fenced off areas using portable fences propped up on 2x4's that stuck out into high traffic pedestrian areas. I tripped more than once. Huge potholes in the parking lot that I saw quite a few people tripping in. Lucky nobody twisted an ankle considering many were walking around with obstructed vision due to costumes. The area where we were to line up for entrance to the concerts had machines and equipment piled up from tarring the roof. Really, they decide to do this the week of a huge convention? Made the entrance for the concerts hard to find, and just looked really trashy. Must have given a great impression to the bands who travelled very far to perform here.
Next AN and just any time they host a convention of this size they need to clean up the parking lot and fill in holes, make sure there are no tripping hazards

reviews.title: Anime North 2014
text: I have been going to the TCC for Anime North since 2008. Since then, Anime North has grown in size with 20K people in attendance. It has been amazing how this venue is able to accommodate this large amount of unique people. Most of the TCC's rooms are able to keep the large population cool. But one particular room that is used for the "dealers room" which has the largest population going through it, tends to get stuffy. Other than that I have no complaints and find the location the best in all of Toronto for extremely large conventions!

reviews.title: Its OK
text: The Toronto Congress Centre - located near the Toronto Pearson Airport is a massive, multi building congress and convention centre. The staff are friendly, but seem to lack motivation, and always seem to be on their phones. The food - was ok

reviews.title: Fantastic place for a convention
text: Very trendy decor, excellent service! It would be helpful if there was better signage on the external property however very nice.  Kept very clean and highly organized staff.

reviews.title: Great food!
text: A little bit hard to get around, as it's a sprawling complex of an event center. I was on foot staying in a hotel nearby, so it took me awhile to arrive at the room for the event I was attending. And it didn't look like there was a way to get through indoors. Plentiful parking though for those arriving by car though.
And the food was incredible compared to what I've experienced at other convention centers.

reviews.title: A very handy location for business gathering
text: I spent three days this week at the congress centre for an industry event, The food was really delicious and the location is great for the airport, as well as my local office.

reviews.title: r.v. show
text: nice place and close to restaurants, clean and friendly staff, parking very close to the event, lots of things to see, booths very organized

reviews.title: good venue
text: Good venue for conferences.  Best may be the free parking
Food is also quite good and staff are very friendly

reviews.title: Huge space
text: Excellent venue for large conferences and trade shows. It's very modern and offers very clean cool spaces to rent

reviews.title: Large Conference experts
text: Attended a conference here in October 2015.  I've attending the same conference at this location several times and it never disappoints.  Very well positioned and the staff are experts at making things run smoothly.

reviews.title: Easy access , great location for conferences .
text: Great location to get to , near the airport, parking was free. good food and Starbucks coffee and tea served.

reviews.title: Conference Centre with rooms using names of notable Canadians
text: If only the occasional roar of the jets were diminished, and there were more places to plug in phones/laptops as attendees, I would have given it a better rating!  For a conference we attended earlier this month, we had a good and comfortable time. Rooms are named after notable Canadian artists, writerz and arts supporters.
The soundproofing could be further enhanced, as occasionally the roar of a jet from Pearson airport can be a distraction.

The staff are polite and non-intrusive. Fresh lemon slices for tea, and good quality food options make for a positive conference experience.  Washrooms are clean and attended to regularly. The place is clean, and a good place for events or meeting functions.   Rooms range from small meetings to cavernous. Hee hee, I remember attending a rave there years ago, and dancing the night away before Toronto got cold feet about letting people enjoy all-night dance parties.
Although I digress, this is a hospitable and good venue. Mobility accessible, and spotless. They even have cute "good morning" and "good afternoon" welcome mats.

reviews.title: Exceptional location for conferences and tradeshows
text: I began working with the Toronto Congress Centre in early 2014 to plan our organization's Annual General Meeting.

From the outset the staff was very helpful and able to cater to our needs. They were prompt in responding to us, treated us like our event was as important as if it were their own, and on the day followed through on their promises and responsibilities as agreed, on time, and without flaw.
The venue's commitment to environmental sustainability is also second-to-none.  It didn't go unnoticed.
If your organization has the budget for it (they're not cheap) and you need a first class venue close to the airport, look no further. This is the place to go.

reviews.title: Watered Down Starbucks
text: They serve Starbucks coffee though you would never know by drinking it.  It is some of the most watered coffee I've ever had.  I wonder how much extra water they add to the mix

reviews.title: Free parking
text: I attend conferences all over and this is one of my favorite venues.  It is easily accessible.  Provides great free parking.  Is close to great restaurants and also has good food themselves. The building is clean and the staff is helpful.

reviews.title: Anime North convention
text: Awesome place when events are happening. Went during the anime north 2018 convention. Great nick nacks and other gift ideas. Everyone is welcome to dress up as anything.

reviews.title: HUGE!
text: This is a very large venue for a conference. Make sure you know which building the conference you are attending is in so you do not have to walk across the parking lot to the correct building ( this could take over 10 mins).
The staff is very helpful, catering was much better than most conference food and the facility was clean with large- clean bathrooms.
Location is good, close to the airport and many hotels in the area.
Would be happy to return to a conference here again.

reviews.title: Anime north 2018
text: This convention center is where anime north is and many other events and is usally filled with people entering here almost all the time. Had a blast coming here with some friends. I highly recommend giving this place a try

reviews.title: RV Show
text: Went to the RV show today at the Congress Centre. Very large facilities, which is necessary for an RV show. Washroom facilities are very nice. The food is decent, but overpriced, which is not unusual for convention centres. However, the food is pre-made in the morning so if you have something like a dairy allergy you can't request no cheese on an item. More food options are a must at large conventions such as this.

reviews.title: RV show 2018
text: We attended the RV show for then first time at the Toronto Congress Centre on Dixon Road.  Plenty of parking available and lies moved quickly at the gate.
Very large venue
Washroom signs seemed to point to nowhere but were very clean once you found one and very nicely decorated.
An enjoyable experience.

reviews.title: Very Good Catering
text: Everytime that we have an event here, the catered food does not disappoint! From breakfast to lunch to dinner, it's all good!

reviews.title: Great convention center and catering
text: Had a trade show here. Very accommodating staff. Lots of parking all over the building.
First class upgrades and amenities.

The food was absolutely top notch. We had all meals catered and it was quite the fancy buffet.  They had a chicken breast that was roasted boneless but had the wing attached. Best chicken dish I've seriously had in a long time.

reviews.title: Extra ordinarily Beautiful
text: I was opportune to attend an Easter even programme organised by The Redeemed Christian Church of God at this centre. The hall was spacious, sound system was superb, hall sitting arrangements was second to none and the parking facilities was spacious.

reviews.title: Toronto RV Show, 2017; Congress Centre
text: We found the show to be lacking a bit compared to other years.  There didn't seem to be as many dealers showing their equipment.  We were there the first day, so it wasn't crowded and you had space to check favourite r v's.   There may have been more floor space allotted to the show.
